passages.text: PIN/PPET/NBPE/TFG JUNAVs, ENRG EGM result

NB Private Equity (NBPE)overweight)- July NAV - NBPF has announced its 31/7/25 NAV which was \(\) 27.54\(share (2,081pp\) \ \(\) 1.3\%\(ahead of our of\)+2.2\%\(including the dividend. The 31/7/25 NAV is 1.3% ahead of our estimate of\) \ \(27.17\) /share (2,055pps). Attribution of the NAV movement in the month to 31/7/25 shows private asset valuation gains added \(2.6\%\) quoted holding valuation movements added \(0.4\%\) and the detractors were FX \(- 0.6\%\) and costs/expenses \(- 0.2\%\) . The underlying portfolio has \(6\%\) valued at 31/7/25 (the quoted holdings), \(86\%\) of direct private investments valued as at \(30 / 6 / 25\) and \(8\%\) of direct private investments valued as at 31/3/25. This is a significant update from the prior June NAV within which all of the private investments were valued as at 31/3/25. NBPE says the private investment valuations were up \(2.3\%\) in Q2 2025 and \(1.9\%\) year to date on a constant currency basis. In 2025 year to date, NBPE has had total realisations of \(\) 71m\$ and made \(\) 11m\$ of follow- on investments. At 31/7/25 NBPE had \(\) 279m\$ of liquidity available comprising \(\) 69m\(of cash and\) \ \(210m\) from an undrawn credit line. NBPE bought back 35,000 shares in July 2025 spending \(\) 0.7m\$ . The shares were purchased at a weighted average discount to NAV of \(27\%\) adding \(Largest movers over the last week (%)

J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

its \(31 / 7 / 25\mathrm{NAV}\) which was 510.4pps \((\pm 2.3\mathrm{bn})\) up \(3.7\%\) month on month and \(0.6\%\) ahead of our estimate of 507.2pps at the same date. Valuation gains \(+0.9\%\) , investment income \(+0.0\%\) , FX movements \(+2.8\%\) and share buybacks \((+0.2\%)\) were the drivers of the NAV gain in July 2025 partially offset by costs/expenses/taxes \(- 0.2\%\) . The underlying portfolio has \(14\%\) of valuations as at \(30 / 6 / 25\) or later of which \(5.4\%\) are the listed holdings marked to market each month. In the prior NAV, PIN had just \(6\%\) of valuations dated \(30 / 6 / 25\) of which \(5.1\%\) were the listed holdings. This implies \(c.8\%\) pts of the portfolio in private investments has been revalued from March 2025 to June 2025. The balance of the asset valuation dates in the \(31 / 7 / 25\mathrm{NAV}\) are \(80\%\) as at \(31 / 3 / 25\) and \(6\%\) as at \(31 / 12 / 24\) . At \(31 / 7 / 25\) PIN had net cash of £4m, asset linked notes outstanding of £21m and undrawn commitments to investments of £732m. PIN has a £400m multi- tranche multi- currency revolving credit facility on which it has drawn £105m and it also has £113m £ equivalent of private placement loan notes. Net debt at \(31 / 7 / 25\) was \(9.5\%\) of NAV. PIN received £23.1m from distributions in July 2025 and funded £14.5m of calls to investment commitments for net cash flow of £8.6m. PIN made £47.3m of new commitments in July 2025 and these included £6.9m in a co- investment with Shamrock Capital Advisors in Penta Group, a US- based communications and intelligence firm, £16.8m in a manager- led secondary transaction alongside Five Arrows investing in six companies and a £23.6m primary commitment to Hg Genesis 11, a European buyout fund focused on software and services companies in Europe. In July 2025 PIN bought back 2.2m shares at a weighted average discount of \(35.0\%\) to the prevailing NAV. The board says that in light of the continued wide discount to NAV at which PIN shares trade, and in light of currently anticipated cash flows, it has allocated £30m to share buybacks between \(1 / 6 / 25\) and the August NAV publication date which it expects to be in September 2025. Of that £30m, PIN has so far spent £19m.

J.P. Morgan View: The reporting lag in the private equity investment companies is normal and based on the prior financial year we expect that PIN's August NAV, likely to be reported in late September, will reflect the bulk of the \(30 / 6 / 25\) valuation marks for the private investments in the portfolio. Generally we have seen Q2 be a more positive quarter for private equity valuation movements than Q1, likely in part reflecting better quoted equity market returns and comparator valuations as well as reduced economic policy/ tariff uncertainty. After updating for the difference between the \(31 / 7 / 25\mathrm{NAV}\) and our estimate, we increase our live estimate by \(0.7\%\) from 501.3pps to 504.8pps. Based on a current share price of \(326\mathrm{pps}\) ( \(@09:30\) ) the headline discount to NAV is \(35.4\%\) but after adding back net debt and deducting listed holdings, the implied discount on the unlisted assets is \(33.9\%\) . These are both wider than the peer averages of \(30.4\%\) and \(29.4\%\) for the headline discount and implied discount on the unlisted holdings for the peer group as a whole. We remain \(\yen 123,456\)

Patria Private Equity (PPET, Neutral) - July NAV - PPET has announced its \(31 / 7 / 25\mathrm{NAV}\) which was 795.4pps ( £1,186m), up \(0.6\%\) month on month with the gain reflecting mostly FX moves including the \(1.0\%\) appreciation in the euro vs sterling and \(3.4\%\) appreciation in the US dollar vs sterling during July. The \(31 / 7 / 25\mathrm{NAV}\) is \(1.0\%\) below our \(803\mathrm{pps}\) estimate. These were partially offset by the deduction of the dividend that PPET accounts for on the paid date. The underlying portfolio valuations in the July NAV are \(95.1\%\) dated \(31 / 3 / 25\) , exactly the same as in the prior June NAV. PPET paid £21.0m in investment drawdowns in July 2025 and received £11.1m of distributions. PPET made one new primary fund commitment and one secondary investment in July. The outstanding investment commitments were £770.6m in aggregate as at \(31 / 7 / 25\) although the manager thinks £91.9m of these are unlikely to be drawn. PPET has £19.7m of cash as at \(31 / 7 / 25\) and is due to receive £97.3m in deferred consideration in September 2025 from its previously announced secondary sale of a portfolio of investments it considered non- core. PPET has a £400m revolving credit facility due to expire in February 2028 and it had drawn £193.6m on this as at \(31 / 7 / 24\) . Net debt at \(31 / 7 / 24\) was therefore £173.9m equivalent to \(14.7\%\) of NAV or, pro- forma for the deferred consideration would be \(6.5\%\)
of NAV. PPET bought back 255,000 share in July 2025.

J.P. Morgan View: After updating for the difference in the 31/7/25 NAV and our estimate, we reduce our live NAV from 802.3pps to 794.3pps. At the current share price of 548.0pps \((\text{@} 09:30)\) the headline discount to our live NAV estimate is \(31.0\%\) and after adding back net debt the implied discount on the unlisted assets is \(28.4\%\) albeit that calculation would result in a wider implied discount if including the deferred consideration. PPET's discount also does not yet reflect any June valuations and so when comparing to peers we need to consider that some of those do reflect partial or full June 2025 valuations for the underlying portfolio. The peer average headline discount is \(30.4\%\) and the peer average implied discount on unlisted assets is \(29.4\%\) which PPET's current valuation is close to. We are Neutral.

VH Global Energy Infrastructure (ENRG, Not Covered) - Result of EGM - ENRG has announced that at its EGM, held on 28/8/25, shareholders approved all four resolutions with \(95\%\) of votes cast in favour of resolutions 1, 2 and 4 and \(99\%\) of votes cast in favour of resolution 3. Turnout was \(c.72\%\) . Resolutions 1 and 2 were to adopt new investment objectives and approve related party transaction in connection with the proposed, and now approved, change to a strategy of a managed wind down and associated remuneration plans. Resolution 3 was the directors remuneration policy approval and resolution 4 was a special resolution to amend the company articles. The proposed managed wind down was first announced in May 2025 (see our note here).

Tetragon Financial Group (TFG, Overweight) - July NAV - TFG has announced its 31/7/25 NAV which represents a NAV TR of \(- 0.6\%\) for the month of July 2025. The underlying portfolio return on equity was \(- 0.5\%\) and gains on bank loan assets and private equity and venture capital investments were offset by valuation losses on TFG Asset Management. Overall investment gains and losses reduced NAV by \(0.10 / \mathrm{share}\) in July. Other movements were \(- 0.08 / \mathrm{share}\) from operated expenses and fees, \(- 0.11 / \mathrm{share}\) from dividend payments and \(- 0.04 / \mathrm{share}\) from other share dilution (likely scrip dividend associated). Based on the current share price of \(17.60 / \mathrm{share}\) the headline discount to NAV is \(54.2\%\) . A re- rating to 'just' a \(40\%\) discount to NAV would result in a share price of \(23.05 / \mathrm{share}\) , \(31\%\) higher than the current share price. We are Overweight.

NB Private Equity (NBPF, Overweight) has announced its 31/7/25 NAV which was \(27.54 / share (2,081\) pps) representing a NAV TR of \(+2.2\%\) including the dividend. The 31/7/25 NAV is \(1.3\%\) ahead of our estimate of \(27.17 / share (2,055\) pps). Attribution of the NAV movement in the month to 31/7/25 shows private asset valuation gains added \(2.6\%\) , quoted holding valuation movements added \(0.4\%\) and the detractors were FX - \(0.6\%\) and costs/expenses - \(0.2\%\) . The underlying portfolio has \(6\%\) valued at 31/7/25 (the quoted holdings), \(86\%\) of direct private investments valued as at \(30 / 6 / 25\) and \(8\%\) of direct private investments valued as at 31/3/25. This is a significant update from the prior June NAV within which all of the private investments were valued as at 31/3/25. NBPF says the private investment valuations were up \(2.3\%\) in Q2 2025 and \(1.9\%\) year to date on a constant currency basis. In 2025 year to date, NBPF has had total realisations of \(71m\) and made \(11m\) of follow- on investments. At 31/7/25 NBPF had \(279m\) of liquidity available comprising \(69m\) of cash and \(210m\) from an undrawn credit line. NBPF bought back 35,000 shares in July 2025 spending \(0.7m\) . The shares were purchased at a weighted average discount to NAV of \(27\%\) adding \(

movements \(+2.8\%\) and share buybacks \((+0.2\%)\) were the drivers of the NAV gain in July 2025 partially offset by costs/expenses/taxes \(- 0.2\%\) . The underlying portfolio has \(14\%\) of valuations as at \(30 / 6 / 25\) or later of which \(5.4\%\) are the listed holdings marked to market each month. In the prior NAV, PIN had just \(6\%\) of valuations dated \(30 / 6 / 25\) of which \(5.1\%\) were the listed holdings. This implies c. \(8\%\) pts of the portfolio in private investments has been revalued from March 2025 to June 2025. The balance of the asset valuation dates in the \(31 / 7 / 25\) NAV are \(80\%\) as at \(31 / 3 / 25\) and \(6\%\) as at \(31 / 12 / 24\) . At \(31 / 7 / 25\) PIN had net cash of £4m, asset linked notes outstanding of £21m and undrawn commitments to investments of £732m. PIN has a £400m multi- tranche multi- currency revolving credit facility on which it has drawn £105m and it also has £113m £ equivalent of private placement loan notes. Net debt at \(31 / 7 / 25\) was \(9.5\%\) of NAV. PIN received £23.1m from distributions in July 2025 and funded £14.5m of calls to investment commitments for net cash flow of £8.6m. PIN made £47.3m of new commitments in July 2025 and these included £6.9m in a co- investment with Shamrock Capital Advisors in Penta Group, a US- based communications and intelligence firm, £16.8m in a manager- led secondary transaction alongside Five Arrows investing in six companies and a £23.6m primary commitment to Hg Genesis 11, a European buyout fund focused on software and services companies in Europe. In July 2025 PIN bought back 2.2m shares at a weighted average discount of \(35.0\%\) to the prevailing NAV. The board says that in light of the continued wide discount to NAV at which PIN shares trade, and in light of currently anticipated cash flows, it has allocated £30m to share buybacks between \(1 / 6 / 25\) and the August NAV publication date which it expects to be in September 2025. Of that £30m, PIN has so far spent £19m.

- The reporting lag in the private equity investment companies is normal and based on the prior financial year we expect that PIN's August NAV, likely to be reported in late September, will reflect the bulk of the \(30 / 6 / 25\) valuation marks for the private investments in the portfolio. Generally we have seen Q2 be a more positive quarter for private equity valuation movements than Q1, likely in part reflecting better quoted equity market returns and comparator valuations as well as reduced economic policy/tariff uncertainty. After updating for the difference between the \(31 / 7 / 25\) NAV and our estimate, we increase our live estimate by \(0.7\%\) from 501.3pps to 504.8pps. Based on a current share price of \(326\) (\\$0.09:30) the headline discount to NAV is \(35.4\%\) but after adding back net debt and deducting listed holdings, the implied discount on the unlisted assets is \(33.9\%\) . These are both wider than the peer averages of \(30.4\%\) and \(29.4\%\) for the headline discount and implied discount on the unlisted holdings for the peer group as a whole. We remain Overweight PIN.

The \(31 / 7 / 25\) NAV is \(1.0\%\) below our 803.8pps estimate. These were partially offset by the deduction of the dividend that PPET accounts for on the paid date. The underlying portfolio valuations in the July NAV are \(95.1\%\) dated \(31 / 3 / 25\) , exactly the same as in the prior June NAV. PPET paid £21.0m in investment drawdowns in July 2025 and received £11.1m of distributions. PPET made one new primary fund commitment and one secondary investment in July. The outstanding investment commitments were £770.6m in aggregate as at \(31 / 7 / 25\) although

the manager thinks £91.9m of these are unlikely to be drawn. PPET has £19.7m of cash as at 31/7/25 and is due to receive £97.3m in deferred consideration in September 2025 from its previously announced secondary sale of a portfolio of investments it considered non- core. PPET has a £400m revolving credit facility due to expire in February 2028 and it had drawn £193.6m on this as at 31/7/24. Net debt at 31/7/24 was therefore £173.9m equivalent to \(14.7\%\) of NAV or, pro- forma for the deferred consideration would be \(6.5\%\) of NAV. PPET bought back 255,000 shares in July 2025.

- After updating for the difference in the 31/7/25 NAV and our estimate, we reduce our live NAV by \(1.0\%\) from 802.3pps to 794.3pps. At the current share price of 548.0pps (@09:30) the headline discount to our live NAV estimate is \(31.0\%\) and after adding back net debt the implied discount on the unlisted assets is \(28.4\%\) albeit that calculation would result in a wider implied discount if including the deferred consideration. PPET's discount also does not yet reflect any June valuations and so when comparing to peers we need to consider that some of those do reflect partial or full June 2025 valuations for the underlying portfolio. The peer average headline discount is \(30.4\%\) and the peer average implied discount on unlisted assets is \(29.4\%\) which PPET's current valuation is close to. We are Neutral.

Tetragon Financial Group (TFG, Overweight) has announced its 31/7/25 NAV which represents a NAV TR of -0.6% for the month of July 2025. The underlying portfolio return on equity was -0.5% and gains on bank loan assets and private equity and venture capital investments were offset by valuation losses on TFG Asset Management. Overall investment gains and losses reduced NAV by $0.10/share in July. Other movements were -$0.08/share from operated expenses and fees, -$0.11/share from dividend payments and -$0.04/share from other share dilution (likely scrip dividend associated).Based on the current share price of $17.60/share the headline discount to NAV is 54.2%.A re-rating to 'just' a 40% discount to NAV would result in a share price of $23.05/share, 31% higher than the current share price. We are Overweight.

For Investment trusts and private equity companies, the following stock recommendation definitions apply: Overweight - the total return on the security is expected to outperform the sector\\* by \(5\%\) or more over the next six months. Neutral - the total return on the security is not expected to outperform or underperform the sector\\* by \(5\%\) or more over the next six months. Underweight - the total return on the security is expected to underperform the sector\\* by \(5\%\) or more over the next six months. Not Rated (NR): J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. \\*the sector comprises those securities covered by the analyst(s) where those securities would be included within the relevant AIC, Datastream or Morningstar sub- sectors. For hedge funds the following stock recommendation definitions apply: Overweight - the risk- adjusted total return on the security is expected to outperform the sector over the next six months. Neutral - the risk adjusted total return on the security is not expected to outperform or underperform the sector over the next six months. Underweight - the risk- adjusted total return on the security is expected to underperform the sector over the next six months. Not Rated (NR): J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. \\*the sector comprises those securities covered by analyst(s) within the relevant J.P. Morgan Cazenove sub- sectors. The J.P. Morgan Cazenove sub- sectors are fund of funds (multi- manager) and single manager funds.
